data.title: Crisis Point
data.meta_description:
Crisis Point by Subhumans, released 13 September 2019

1. Terrorist In Waiting
2. Fear And Confusion
3. Information Gap
4. Atom Screen War
5. Follow The Leader
6. Strange Land
7. 99%
8. Punk Machine
9. Poison
10. â™«
11. Thought Is Free

The first new record from Lucas and his Subhumans in a while (Twelve Years?) and with the current global situation its not like Lucas has had writers block or lacking the inspiration. Everywhere you look thereâ€™s a meltdown â€“ climate change, government leaders lying, despots taking over, smiling, lying and cheating yet it seems OK to the public. Nobody loses their jobs its all fair game. Summed up nicely on â€˜Fear & Confusionâ€™. A more polished sounding record that their last outing â€˜Internal Riotâ€™ but it every bit as sharp and relevant.

To be fair Subhumans have always released intelligent records their Anarcho leanings have always been dressed really well in big riffs, tight time changes and some sharp as fuck punk rock. â€˜Crisis Pointâ€™ seems apt as Lucas starts the war cry with the flurry of opening punches on â€˜Terrorist In Waitingâ€™ great lyrics (as usual) thunderous drumming and riffs raining down on the listener with an energy and excitement that sets the album up really well.

throughout the albums eleven tracks the ebb and flow is excellent. I love the attitude on â€˜Atom Screen Warâ€™ emanating from the riff as it pounds away but itâ€™s nicely pinned by the bass thats rumbling away underneath. To be fair the sound is reminiscent of the last few UK Subs albums. â€˜Follow The Leaderâ€™ takes that edginess up a notch as the album has warmed up and is really taking flight. Strange land has the feel and sound the band had back in the â€™80s with that flange riff and repetitive beat its a really good tune and one that shows how bloody good a band Subhumans are.

Its no good looking for a weakness because there isnâ€™t one. Its a really consistent album its focused and as youâ€™d imagine thought provoking with excellent lyrics and a great production. â€˜Crisis Pointâ€™ is ticking all the boxes whats not to like? If you want fast no nonsense heads down punk rock then Subhumans do that â€˜Poisonâ€™ if you want intricate musicianship Subhumans can do that for you, if you want lyrics that are well constructed and thought provoking to prick your conscience subhumans can do that. They were a big part of that early â€™80s punk explosion and are still going strong along with the Subs, they always turned in better records than Crass and Conflict in my humble opinion and this record is proof that they are as relevant now as they always were. â€˜Crisis Pointâ€™ can cover all your modern punk rock needs as well as you old school punks wondering if Dick has still got it. Of course he has. My advice is get hold of â€˜Crisis Pointâ€™ now and get on board its never too late. Buy it!
Dom Daley, RPM Online
